metadata.title: CVE-2019-10142 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's freescale hypervisor managerimplementation, kernel versions 5.0.x up to, excluding 5.0.17. A parameterpassed to an ioctl was incorrectly validated and used in size calculationsfor the page size calculation. An attacker can use this flaw to crash thesystem, corrupt memory, or create other adverse security affects.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10142` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-37-generic - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-37-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-37-lowlatency - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-37-generic - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-37-lowlatency - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1018-aws - 5.4.0-1018.18~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1082-azure - 4.15.0-1082.92
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1020-azure - 5.4.0-1020.20~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-gcp - 4.15.0-1071.81
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1019-gcp - 5.4.0-1019.19~18.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1010-ibm - 5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1019-oracle - 5.4.0-1019.19~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1013-raspi - 5.4.0-1013.13~18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1').
linux-aws-5.4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1018.18~18.04.1').
linux-azure-4.15 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1082.92').
linux-azure-5.4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1020.20~18.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1039.44+recert2').
linux-aws-fips: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-azure-fips: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-gcp-fips: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-gcp-4.15 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1071.81').
linux-gcp-5.4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1019.19~18.04.2').
linux-ibm-5.4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2').
linux-oracle-5.4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1019.19~18.04.1').
linux-raspi-5.4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1013.13~18.04.1').
